text:
Editable fields that will be held within the Quote itself, on the page? That gets messy quickly, particularly if you intend on using the quote wizard in conjunction with this kind of functionality.

My recommendation would be to create your own UI, using a CRM card held on Deals. With serverless functions to facilitate all of the necessary API requests -> create the quote. And skip the editable fields on the quote page idea altogether.

There are alternative methods. Iâ€™ve tried quite a few of them, and the results were never satisfactory.
Is it an actual email domain? Have you tested a real domain?
I solved it for now by using the line items instead of using the quote directly.
